basic_usage.description: Basic usage of TokenAdapter to get token information
basic_usage.code:
from adapters.token_adapter.adapter import TokenAdapter

# Initialize adapter (no config needed)
adapter = TokenAdapter()

# Get token by address (provide chain_id when querying by address)
success, data = await adapter.get_token(
    "0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef12345678",
    chain_id=8453,
)
if success:
    print(f"Token symbol: {data.get('symbol')}")
    print(f"Token name: {data.get('name')}")
    print(f"Decimals: {data.get('decimals')}")
else:
    print(f"Error: {data}")

get_by_token_id.description: Get token information using token ID
get_by_token_id.code:
from adapters.token_adapter.adapter import TokenAdapter

# Initialize adapter (no config needed)
adapter = TokenAdapter()

# Get token by ID
success, data = await adapter.get_token("token-12345")
if success:
    print(f"Token data: {data}")
else:
    print(f"Error: {data}")

error_handling.description: Proper error handling for various scenarios
error_handling.code:
from adapters.token_adapter.adapter import TokenAdapter

# Initialize adapter (no config needed)
adapter = TokenAdapter()

# Handle API errors
success, data = await adapter.get_token("invalid-address")
if not success:
    print(f"API error: {data}")
else:
    print(f"Token found: {data}")

health_check.code:
from adapters.token_adapter.adapter import TokenAdapter

# Initialize adapter (no config needed)
adapter = TokenAdapter()

# Check health
health = await adapter.health_check()
print(f"Adapter status: {health['status']}")
print(f"Connected: {health['connected']}")
print(f"Adapter type: {health['adapter']}")

if health['status'] == 'healthy':
    print("Adapter is ready to use")
else:
    print(f"Adapter has issues: {health.get('error', 'Unknown error')}")
